name: Amber Docks
economy_niches: warehousing and re-export of ritual reagents
charter finance, brokers and maritime insurance
culture_adjustments: Guilds hold greater day-to-day power than inland clan-houses
Harbor augury rituals routinized into sailing schedules
Practical language mixing with islander Coastal Tongues variants
Commercialized seafaring superstitions used in marketing
Patronage networks oriented around shipping lines, not landholdings
constraints: Limited heavy steam industry; shipyards rely on timber and low-pressure mechanisms
Ritual magic requires imported reagents that must be stored and guarded
notes: Navigational auguries practiced locally but do not replace charts or seamanship
Merchant Brotherhood controls many port licenses and dispute arbitration
